content.full_text: Breast implant associated anaplastic large cell lymphoma (BIA-ALCL) is a type of lymphoma that can develop around breast implants. Assign code C84.7A, Anaplastic large cell lymphoma, ALK-negative, breast, for BIA-ALCL or C84.7B, Anaplastic large cell lymphoma, ALK-negative, in remission, for BIA-ALCL in remission. Do not assign a complication code from chapter 19. (Evidence: pg no: 39, L6-L9)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding breast implant associated anaplastic large cell lymphoma using specific C84.7 codes without complication codes (Evidence: pg no: 39, L6-L9)
key_concepts: BIA-ALCL is lymphoma developing around breast implants (Evidence: pg no: 39, L7-L8)
Use specific C84.7 codes for active and remission states (Evidence: pg no: 39, L8-L9)
Do not use Chapter 19 complication codes (Evidence: pg no: 39, L9)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign code C84.7A for active BIA-ALCL (Evidence: pg no: 39, L8)
detailed_rules.explanation: For breast implant associated anaplastic large cell lymphoma that is currently active, use the specific code C84.7A which identifies ALK-negative anaplastic large cell lymphoma of the breast (Evidence: pg no: 39, L8)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign code C84.7B for BIA-ALCL in remission (Evidence: pg no: 39, L8-L9)
detailed_rules.explanation: When breast implant associated anaplastic large cell lymphoma is documented as being in remission, use code C84.7B (Evidence: pg no: 39, L8-L9)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign complication codes from Chapter 19 (Evidence: pg no: 39, L9)
detailed_rules.explanation: BIA-ALCL should not be coded as a complication of the breast implant using Chapter 19 codes, but rather as the specific lymphoma it represents (Evidence: pg no: 39, L9)
common_applications: Proper classification as neoplasm rather than complication
